https://files.catbox.moe/qhgv2f.png
We've exceeded the character limit by 3,720!

We don't need to paste the oshi mark on Twitter either. 
Opening the file in a text editor like Notepad, Notepad++, Sublime Text, Vi, or Nano reveals weird artifacts too.

There are two ways to see what's going on this:

1. Go to a Unicode text analyzer (https://www.fontspace.com/unicode/analyzer) and paste the oshi mark.
Notice that the text is comprised of ZERO WIDTH NON-JOINER (U+200C) and VARIATION SELECTOR-[1-16] (U+FE0[0-F]).

2. Open the text file in a hex editor.
Notice that the text repeats the pattern "E2 80 8C EF B8 8X" where X can be 0 to F.

Regardless, next we can ask ChatGPT to write a Python script to extract every 12th hexadecimal character, excluding the emojis at the beginning and end (see solve.py)
